fragilities.comments:
Costing is on a per connection basis.  Costing does not include fireproofing removal or reapplication cost.
Author: Greg Deierlein
fragilities.description: Bolted shear tab gravity connections

damageStates.description: Yielding of shear tab and elongation of bolt holes, possible crack initiation around bolt holes or at shear tab weld.  Damage in field is either obscured or deemed to not warrant repair.  No repair conducted.
damageStates.name: DS1
damageStates.repairAction: Careful inspection and welded repair to any cracks and possible replacement of shear tab if bolt hole deformations are excessive (possible for deeper 6-bolt or deeper shear tabs).  Field condition is deemed to not warrant repair by field observation.  This Damage State is Mutually Exclusive with DS2.  See fragility DS1 and DS2 probabilities.

damageStates.description: Yielding of shear tab and elongation of bolt holes, possible crack initiation around bolt holes or at shear tab weld.
damageStates.name: DS2
damageStates.repairAction: Careful inspection and welded repair to any cracks and possible replacement of shear tab if bolt hole deformations are excessive (possible for deeper 6-bolt or deeper shear tabs).

damageStates.description: Partial tearing of shear tab and possibility of bolt shear failure (6-bolt or deeper connections).
damageStates.name: DS3
damageStates.repairAction: Repairs will include either welded repair of shear tab or possible complete replacement of shear tab and installation of new bolts.  Repairs may require shoring of beam.

damageStates.description: Complete separation of shear tab, close to complete loss of vertical load resistance.
damageStates.name: DS4
damageStates.repairAction: Repair will include complete replacement of shear tab and installation of new bolts. Repairs will require shoring of beam.

fragilities.comments:
Costing is on a per connection basis.  Costing does not include fireproofing removal or reapplication cost.
Author: Greg Deierlein
fragilities.description: Steel Column Base Plates, Column W < 150 plf

damageStates.description: Initiation of crack at the fusion line between the column flange and the base plate weld.  Damage in field is either obscured or deemed to not warrant repair.  No repair conducted.
damageStates.name: DS1
damageStates.repairAction: The repair will involve removal of a portion of grade slab, gouging out material surrounding the fracture initiating and re-welding, then repair of slab. Field condition is deemed to not warrant repair by field observation.  This Damage State is Mutually Exclusive with DS2.  See fragility DS1 and DS2 probabilities.

damageStates.description: Initiation of crack at the fusion line between the column flange and the base plate weld.
damageStates.name: DS2
damageStates.repairAction: The repair will involve removal of a portion of grade slab, gouging out material surrounding the fracture initiating and re-welding, then repair of slab.

damageStates.description: Propagation of brittle crack into column and/or base plate.
damageStates.name: DS3
damageStates.repairAction: Depending on the crack trajectory, the repair will range from replacement of a portion of the column or base plate to full replacement of the column base. Replacement will require shoring of column, torch cutting to remove damaged material, and fabrication and field welding to install replacement material.

damageStates.description: Complete fracture of the column (or column weld) and dislocation of column relative to the base.
damageStates.name: DS4
damageStates.repairAction: Repair would likely involve replacing the entire base plate assembly and most of the column in the story above the base plate.

fragilities.comments:
Costing is on a per connection basis.  Costing does not include fireproofing removal or reapplication cost.
Author: Greg Deierlein

fragilities.comments:
Costing is on a per connection basis.  Costing does not include fireproofing removal or reapplication cost.
Notes: Fracture is not expected where weld has adequate toughness and the maximum weld root stress is below 1.5Fu from column P/A+M/S under story drift using A and S from weld root area.  
Author: Greg Deierlein
fragilities.description: Welded column splices, Column W < 150 plf

damageStates.description: Ductile fracture of the groove weld flange splice.   Damage in field is either obscured or deemed to not warrant repair.  No repair conducted.
damageStates.name: DS1
damageStates.repairAction: Repair would involve gouging out the material adjacent to the fracture and repairing with a new groove weld.  Field condition is deemed to not warrant repair by field observation.  This Damage State is Mutually Exclusive with DS2.  See fragility DS1 and DS2 probabilities.

damageStates.description: Ductile fracture of the groove weld flange splice.
damageStates.name: DS2
damageStates.repairAction: Repair would involve gouging out the material adjacent to the fracture and repairing with a new groove weld.

damageStates.description: DS1 followed by complete failure of the web splice plate and dislocation of the two column segments on either side of the splice.
damageStates.name: DS3
damageStates.repairAction: Repair may not be practically feasible, but would require either realignment or replacement of adjacent column segments and rewelding of splice.

fragilities.comments:

fragilities.comments: Costing is on a per bay basis.  Costing does not include fireproofing removal or reapplication cost.
fragilities.description: Special Concentric Braced Frame w WF braces, balanced design criteria, Chevron Brace, Brace w < 40 PLF

damageStates.description: Buckling of the brace has begun but does not exceed the depth of the brace.  Initial yielding of the gusset has begun.  Yielding has initiated in framing at gusset plates but no buckling has occurred.  Residual buckling of the brace has occurred but is barely noticeable to the naked eye and does not exceed half the brace depth.  Residual drift is slight.
damageStates.name: DS1
damageStates.repairAction: Brace damage is largely aesthetic.  Heat straightening may be desirable but replacement would be for aesthetic reasons.  Gusset has minor loss of strength and stiffness and straightening or repair may be desirable aesthetic reasons.

damageStates.description: Buckling of brace in excess of the brace depth.  Initiation of yielding and out-of-plane deformation of the gusset.  Initiation of cracking of welds of gusset.  Initiation of yielding in beams and columns adjacent to gusset.
damageStates.name: DS2
damageStates.repairAction: Brace has lost significant axial capacity, and replacement of braces is likely required.  The gusset plate may have significant deformation and replacement may also be needed. Local beam and column yielding has occurred and straightening may be desirable for aesthetic reasons.

damageStates.description: Buckling of brace in excess of 2 times brace depth.  Yielding and out-of-plane deformation of gusset.  Cracking and tearing of welds and gussets adjacent to welds but crack length is less than critical for fracture.  Significant yielding and local buckling in beams and columns adjacent to gusset.
damageStates.name: DS3
damageStates.repairAction: Brace and gusset are severely damaged with significant loss in stiffness and resistance, and both likely require replacement. Yielding and local buckling of beams and columns may be repaired by heat straightening, stiffeners or reinforcement, if there is no cracking or tearing. If cracking or tearing has initiated more substantial repair is needed

damageStates.description: Fracture of brace or gusset.  Buckling of gusset.  Severe yielding of beams and columns adjacent to the gusset with possibility of local buckling and cracking in the yielded areas.
damageStates.name: DS4
damageStates.repairAction: Brace and or gusset have fractured and require replacement. Yielding and local buckling of beams and columns may be repaired by heat straightening, stiffeners or reinforcement, if there is no cracking or tearing. If cracking or tearing has initiated more substantial repair is needed

fragilities.comments: Costing is on a per bay basis.  Costing does not include fireproofing removal or reapplication cost.

damageStates.description: Buckling of the brace has begun but does not exceed the depth of the brace.  Initial yielding of the gusset has begun.  Yielding has initiated in framing at gusset plates but no buckling has occurred.  Residual buckling of the brace has occurred but is barely noticeable to the naked eye and does not exceed half the brace depth.  Residual drift is slight.
damageStates.name: DS1
damageStates.repairAction: Brace damage is largely aesthetic.  Heat straightening may be desirable but replacement would be for aesthetic reasons.  Gusset has minor loss of strength and stiffness and straightening or repair may be desirable aesthetic reasons.

damageStates.description: Buckling of brace in excess of the brace depth.  Initiation of yielding and out-of-plane deformation of the gusset.  Initiation of cracking of welds of gusset.  Initiation of yielding in beams and columns adjacent to gusset.
damageStates.name: DS2
damageStates.repairAction: Brace has lost significant axial capacity, and replacement of braces is likely required.  Tapered gusset plates typically sustain greater damage and there is a higher probability that replacement will be needed.  Local beam and column yielding has occurred and straightening may be desirable for aesthetic reasons.

damageStates.description: Buckling of brace in excess of 2 time brace depth .  Yielding and out-of-plane deformation of gusset .  Cracking and tearing of welds and gussets adjacent to welds but crack length is less than critical for fracture .  Significant yielding and local buckling in beams and columns adjacent to gusset .
damageStates.name: DS3
damageStates.repairAction: Brace and gusset are severely damaged with significant loss in stiffness and resistance, and both likely require replacement. Yielding and local buckling of beams and columns may be repaired by heat straightening, stiffeners or reinforcement, if there is no cracking or tearing. If cracking or tearing has initiated more substantial repair is needed

damageStates.description: Fracture of brace or gusset.  Buckling of gusset.  Severe yielding of beams and columns adjacent to the gusset with possibility of local buckling and cracking in the yielded areas.
damageStates.name: DS4
damageStates.repairAction: Brace and or gusset have fractured and require replacement. Yielding and local buckling of beams and columns may be repaired by heat straightening, stiffeners or reinforcement, if there is no cracking or tearing. If cracking or tearing has initiated more substantial repair is needed

fragilities.description: Ordinary Concentric Braced Frame w compact braces, Chevron Brace, Brace w < 40 PLF

damageStates.description: Buckling of the brace has begun but does not exceed the depth of the brace.  Initial yielding of the gusset has begun.  Yielding has initiated in framing at gusset plates but no buckling has occurred. damageStates.name: DS1
damageStates.repairAction: Brace damage is largely aesthetic.  Heat straightening may be desirable but replacement would be for aesthetic reasons.  Gusset has minor loss of strength and stiffness and straightening or repair may be desirable aesthetic reasons.

damageStates.description: Brace has buckled but residual displacement does not exceed two times brace depth.  Brace has not fractured.  Gusset plate exhibits extensive yielding.  Yielding extends well into the members.
damageStates.name: DS2
damageStates.repairAction: Replace brace.  Gusset plate must be replaced 50% of the time.  Heat straightening of deformed beams and columns may be required.

damageStates.description: Brace has fractured.  Gusset plate has torn, possibly completely free of framing.  Local buckling of flanges and web of framing members.  Bolt fractures in beam-column connections.
damageStates.name: DS3
damageStates.repairAction: Replace brace.  Gusset plate must be replaced 90% of the time.  Replacement of portions (deformed flanges, webs) of permanently deformed beams and columns likely required.

Residual deformation of the brace has occurred but is barely noticeable to the naked eye and does not exceed half the brace depth.  Residual drift is slight.
damageStates.name: DS1
damageStates.repairAction: Brace damage is largely aesthetic.  Heat straightening may be desirable but replacement would be for aesthetic reasons.  Gusset has minor loss of strength and stiffness and straightening or repair may be desirable aesthetic reasons.

damageStates.description: Brace has buckled but residual displacement does not exceed two times brace depth.  Brace has not fractured.  Gusset plate exhibits extensive yielding.  Yielding extends well into the members.
damageStates.name: DS2
damageStates.repairAction: Replace brace.  Gusset plate must be replaced 50% of the time.  Heat straightening of deformed beams and columns may be required.

damageStates.description: Brace has fractured.  Gusset plate has torn, possibly completely free of framing.  Local buckling of flanges and web of framing members.  Bolt fractures in beam-column connections.
damageStates.name: DS3
damageStates.repairAction: Replace brace.  Gusset plate must be replaced 90% of the time.  Replacement of portions (deformed flanges, webs) of permanently deformed beams and columns likely required.

fragilities.comments: Costing on a per bay basis, braces may be HSS, WF, or Angle.  Costing does not include fireproofing removal or reapplication cost.
fragilities.description: Ordinary Concentric Braced Frame w compact braces, Single Diagonal Brace, Brace w > 100 PLF

fragilities.comments: Costing on a per bay basis, equivalent to AISC OCBF criteria.  Braces may be HSS, WF, or Angle.  Costing does not include fireproofing removal or reapplication cost.
fragilities.description: Ordinary Concentric Braced Frame, braces design to ductile slenderness limits, Chevron Brace, Brace w < 40 PLF

damageStates.description: Buckling of brace in excess of the brace depth.  Initiation of yielding and out-of-plane deformation of the gusset.  Initiation of cracking of welds of gusset.  Initiation of yielding in beams and columns adjacent to gusset.
damageStates.name: DS1
damageStates.repairAction: Brace damage is largely aesthetic.  Heat straightening may be desirable but replacement would be for aesthetic reasons.  Gusset has minor loss of strength and stiffness and straightening or repair may be desirable aesthetic reasons.

damageStates.description: Buckling of brace in excess of 2 time brace depth.  Yielding and out-of-plane deformation of gusset.  Cracking and tearing of welds and gussets adjacent to welds but crack length is less than critical for fracture.  Significant yielding and local buckling in beams and columns adjacent to gusset.
damageStates.name: DS2
damageStates.repairAction: Brace has lost significant axial capacity, and replacement of braces is likely required.  The gusset plate may have significant deformation and replacement may also be needed. Local beam and column yielding has occurred and straightening may be desirable for aesthetic reasons.

damageStates.description: Fracture of brace or gusset.  Buckling of gusset.  Severe yielding of beams and columns adjacent to the gusset with possibility of local buckling and cracking in the yielded areas.  Nearly total loss of lateral resistance.
damageStates.name: DS3
damageStates.repairAction: Brace and gusset are severely damaged with significant loss in stiffness and resistance, and both likely require replacement. Yielding and local buckling of beams and columns may be repaired by heat straightening, stiffeners or reinforcement, if there is no cracking or tearing. If cracking or tearing has initiated more substantial repair is needed

fragilities.comments:
Costing on a per bay basis, equivalent to current AISC R=3.  Braces may be HSS, WF, or Angle.  Costing does not include fireproofing removal or reapplication cost.
Notes: Performance data has 1 damage state where as the cost data has 3 damage states.  The performance data listed in DS1 appears to correspond to the cost data currently shown in DS3…  Please confirm if two additional damage state performances should be added or if only one cost damage state should be included.

damageStates.name: DS1
damageStates.repairAction: Brace and gusset are severely damaged with significant loss in stiffness and resistance, and both likely require replacement.  Yielding and local buckling of beams and columns may be repaired by heat straightening, stiffeners or reinforcement, if there is no cracking or tearing.  If cracking or tearing has initiated more substantial repair is needed.

fragilities.comments:
Costing on a per bay basis, equivalent to current AISC R=3.  Braces may be HSS, WF, or Angle.  Costing does not include fireproofing removal or reapplication cost.
Notes: Performance data has 1 damage state where as the cost data has 3 damage states.  The performance data listed in DS1 appears to correspond to the cost data currently shown in DS3…  Please confirm if two additional damage state performances should be added or if only one cost damage state should be included.

fragilities.comments:
Costing is on a per bay basis.  Costing does not include fireproofing removal or reapplication cost.
Author: Greg Deierlein
fragilities.description: Post-Northridge RBS connection with welded web, beam one side of column only, beam depth <= W27

damageStates.description: Local beam flange and web buckling.
damageStates.name: DS1
damageStates.repairAction: The likely repair state is heat straightening of the buckled flanges and web.  Repair and replace partitions at connection.

damageStates.description: DS1 plus lateral-torsional distortion of beam in hinge region.
damageStates.name: DS2
damageStates.repairAction: Repair will necessitate removal and replacement of distorted and or fractured portion of beam.   Repair and replace partitions at connection.

damageStates.description: Low-cycle fatigue fracture in buckled region of RBS.
damageStates.name: DS3
damageStates.repairAction: Repair will necessitate removal and replacement of distorted and/or fractured portion of beam.  Repair and replace partitions at connection.

Author: Greg Deierlein
fragilities.description: Pre-Northridge WUF-B beam-column joint, beam one side of column, beam depth <= W27

damageStates.description: Fracture of lower beam flange weld and failure of web bolts (shear tab connection), with fractures confined to the weld region.
damageStates.name: DS1
damageStates.repairAction: Repair will typically require gouging out and re-welding of the beam flange weld, repair of shear tab, and replacing shear bolts.  Repair and replace partitions at connection.

damageStates.description: Similar to DS1, except that fracture propagates into column flanges.
damageStates.name: DS2
damageStates.repairAction: In addition to column measures for DS1, repairs to column will be necessary.  Cover plate, patch, or replace damaged column flange at connection.

damageStates.description: Fracture of upper beam flange weld, without DS1 type damage.  Fracture is confined to beam flange region.
damageStates.name: DS3
damageStates.repairAction: Repairs will be similar to those required for DS1, except that access to weld will likely require removal and replacement of a portion of the floor slab above the weld.

damageStates.description: Similar to DS3, except that fracture propagates into column flanges.
damageStates.name: DS4
damageStates.repairAction: In addition to column measures for DS3, repairs to column will be necessary that will involve replacing a portion of the column flange.

damageStates.description: Fracture initiating at weld access hole and propagating through beam flange, possibly accompanied by local buckling deformations of web and flange.
damageStates.name: DS5
damageStates.repairAction: Repair is similar to that for DS1 except that a portion of the beam web and flange may need to be heat straightened or replaced.

damageStates.description: Damage to concrete slab above the link beam.

damageStates.description: Web local buckling, flange local buckling.
damageStates.name: DS2
damageStates.repairAction: Heat straightening of buckled elements.

damageStates.description: Initiation of fracture in the link beam and link flange.
damageStates.name: DS3
damageStates.repairAction: Replace EBF link.

fragilities.comments:
ACI318 Concrete SMF, ductile response.  Meets the requirements of ACI318 SMF.  Costing is on a per joint basis.
Notes: Note: DS4 is a copy of DS2 to create a mutually exclusive compliment to DS3.
Author: Laura Lowes
fragilities.description: ACI 318 SMF , Conc Col & Bm = 24" x 24", Beam one side

damageStates.description: Beams or joints exhibit residual crack widths > 0.06 in.  No significant spalling.  No fracture or buckling of reinforcing.
damageStates.name: DS1
damageStates.repairAction: Remove furnishings, ceilings and mechanical, electrical and plumbing systems (as necessary) 8 feet either side of damaged area.  Clean area adjacent to the damaged concrete.  Prepare spalled concrete and adjacent cracks, as necessary, to be patched and to receive the epoxy injection.  Patch concrete with grout. Replace and repair finishes.  Replace furnishings, ceilings and mechanical, electrical and plumbing systems as necessary.

damageStates.description: Beams or joints exhibit residual crack widths > 0.06 in. Spalling of cover concrete exposes beam and joint transverse reinforcement but not longitudinal reinforcement. No fracture or buckling of reinforcing.
damageStates.name: DS2
damageStates.repairAction:
Remove furnishings, ceilings and mechanical, electrical and
plumbing systems (as necessary) 15 feet either side of
damaged area. Shore damaged member(s) a min one level below (more levels may be required). Remove damaged concrete at least 1 inch beyond the exposed
reinforcing steel. Place concrete forms. Place concrete.
Remove forms. Remove shores after one week. Replace and
repair finishes. Replace furnishings, ceilings and mechanical,
electrical and plumbing systems (as necessary).

damageStates.description: Beams or joints exhibit residual crack widths > 0.06 in. Spalling of cover concrete exposes a significant length of beam longitudinal reinforcement. Crushing of core concrete may occur. Fracture or buckling of reinforcing requiring replacement may occur.
damageStates.name: DS3
damageStates.repairAction: Remove furnishings, ceilings and mechanical, electrical and plumbing systems (as necessary) 15 feet either side of damaged component. Shore damaged member(s) a minimum of one level below (more levels may be required).  Remove damaged component.  Place and splice (as necessary) new reinforcing steel to existing, undamaged reinforcing.  Place concrete forms.  Place concrete.  Remove forms.  Remove shores after one week.  Replace and repair finishes.  Replace furnishings, ceilings and mechanical, electrical and plumbing systems (as necessary).

damageStates.description: Beams or joints exhibit residual crack widths > 0.06 in. Spalling of cover concrete exposes beam and joint transverse reinforcement but not longitudinal reinforcement. No fracture or buckling of reinforcing.
damageStates.name: DS4
damageStates.repairAction: Remove furnishings, ceilings and mechanical, electrical and plumbing systems (as necessary) 15 feet either side of damaged area.  Shore damaged member(s) a min one level below (more levels may be required).  Remove damaged concrete at least 1 inch beyond the exposed reinforcing steel.  Place concrete forms.  Place concrete.   Remove forms.  Remove shores after one week.  Replace and repair finishes.  Replace furnishings, ceilings and mechanical, electrical and plumbing systems (as necessary).

fragilities.comments:
Non-conforming SMF, joint shear damage, beam flexural response.  Meets the following requirements:  (1) Sum Mcol / Sum Mbeam > 1.2, (2) Column Pu < 0.6f'cAg, (3) Column flexural response with HIGH ductility, (4) Beam compliant transverse reinforcing with low beam V/bwd(f'c)^0.5, (5) Joints with compliant transverse reinforcing details with spacing < d(column)/2 and Joint V/Vn < 1.2.  Costing is on a per joint basis.
Notes: Note: DS4 is a copy of DS2 to create a mutually exclusive compliment to DS3.

damageStates.description: Beams or joints exhibit residual crack widths > 0.06 in. Spalling of cover concrete exposes a significant length of beam longitudinal reinforcement. Crushing of core concrete may occur. Fracture or buckling of reinforcing requiring replacement may occur.
damageStates.name: DS3
damageStates.repairAction: Remove furnishings, ceilings and mechanical, electrical and plumbing systems (as necessary) 15 feet either side of damaged component. Shore damaged member(s) a minimum of one level below (more levels may be required).  Remove damaged component.  Place and splice (as necessary) new reinforcing steel to existing, undamaged reinforcing.  Place concrete forms.  Place concrete.  Remove forms.  Remove shores after one week.  Replace and repair finishes.  Replace furnishings, ceilings and mechanical, electrical and plumbing systems (as necessary).

fragilities.comments:
Non-conforming SMF, joint shear damage, beam flexural response.  Meets the following requirements:  (1) Sum Mcol / Sum Mbeam > 1.2, (2) Column Pu < 0.6f'cAg, (3) Column flexural response with HIGH ductility, (4) Beam compliant transverse reinforcing with low beam V/bwd(f'c)^0.5, (5) Joints with compliant transverse reinforcing details with spacing < d(column)/2 and Joint V/Vn < 1.2.  Costing is on a per joint basis.
Notes: Note: DS4 is a copy of DS2 to create a mutually exclusive compliment to DS3.

damageStates.description: Beams or joints exhibit residual crack widths > 0.06 in.  No significant spalling.  No fracture or buckling of reinforcing.
damageStates.name: DS1
damageStates.repairAction: Remove furnishings, ceilings and mechanical, electrical and plumbing systems (as necessary) 8 feet either side of damaged area.  Clean area adjacent to the damaged concrete.  Prepare spalled concrete and adjacent cracks, as necessary, to be patched and to receive the epoxy injection.  Patch concrete with grout. Replace and repair finishes.  Replace furnishings, ceilings and mechanical, electrical and plumbing systems as necessary.

damageStates.description: Beams or joints exhibit residual crack widths > 0.06 in. Spalling of cover concrete exposes beam and joint transverse reinforcement but not longitudinal reinforcement. No fracture or buckling of reinforcing.
damageStates.name: DS2
damageStates.repairAction:
Remove furnishings, ceilings and mechanical, electrical and
plumbing systems (as necessary) 15 feet either side of
damaged area. Shore damaged member(s) a min one level below (more levels may be required). Remove damaged concrete at least 1 inch beyond the exposed
reinforcing steel. Place concrete forms. Place concrete.
Remove forms. Remove shores after one week. Replace and
repair finishes. Replace furnishings, ceilings and mechanical,
electrical and plumbing systems (as necessary).

damageStates.description: Beams or joints exhibit residual crack widths > 0.06 in. Spalling of cover concrete exposes a significant length of beam longitudinal reinforcement. Crushing of core concrete may occur. Fracture or buckling of reinforcing requiring replacement may occur.
damageStates.name: DS3
damageStates.repairAction: Remove furnishings, ceilings and mechanical, electrical and plumbing systems (as necessary) 15 feet either side of damaged component. Shore damaged member(s) a minimum of one level below (more levels may be required).  Remove damaged component.  Place and splice (as necessary) new reinforcing steel to existing, undamaged reinforcing.  Place concrete forms.  Place concrete.  Remove forms.  Remove shores after one week.  Replace and repair finishes.  Replace furnishings, ceilings and mechanical, electrical and plumbing systems (as necessary).

fragilities.comments:
ACI318 OMF, joint shear failure, beam flexural response.  Meets the following requirements: (1) Sum Mcol / Sum Mbeam > 1.2, (2) Beam Vn > Veq, (3) Column Vn > Veq.  Costing is on a per joint basis.

Place and splice (as necessary) new reinforcing steel to existing, undamaged reinforcing.  Place concrete forms.  Place concrete.  Remove forms.  Remove shores after one week.  Replace and repair finishes.  Replace furnishings, ceilings and mechanical, electrical and plumbing systems (as necessary).

fragilities.comments:
ACI318 OMF, beam flexure-shear or shear failure, beam flexural response.  Meets the following requirements:  (1) Beam Vn < Veq.  Costing is on a per joint basis.
Author: Laura Lowes
fragilities.description: ACI 318 OMF with weak beams and weak joints, beam flexural or shear response, Conc Col & Bm = 36" x 36", Beam one side

damageStates.description: Beams exhibit residual crack widths > 0.06 in.  No significant spalling.  No fracture or buckling of reinforcing.
damageStates.name: DS1
damageStates.repairAction: Remove furnishings, ceilings and mechanical, electrical and plumbing systems (as necessary) 8 feet either side of damaged area.  Clean area adjacent to the damaged concrete.  Prepare spalled concrete and adjacent cracks, as necessary, to be patched and to receive the epoxy injection. Patch concrete with grout.  Replace and repair finishes. Replace furnishings, ceilings and mechanical, electrical and plumbing systems as necessary.

fragilities.description: ACI 318 OMF weak columns w/ high axial load, Conc Col & Bm = 24" x 24", Beam one side

damageStates.description:
Concrete Cracking: beams, joints or possibly. Residual concrete crack widths exceed 0.06in. (1.5 mm).
Column exhibits residual crack widths that require epoxy injection.
damageStates.name: DS1
damageStates.repairAction: Remove furnishings, ceilings and mechanical, electrical and plumbing systems (as necessary) 8 feet either side of damaged area.  Clean area adjacent to the damaged concrete.  Prepare spalled concrete and adjacent cracks, as necessary, to be patched and to receive the epoxy injection. Patch concrete with grout.  Replace and repair finishes. Replace furnishings, ceilings and mechanical, electrical and plumbing systems as necessary.

damageStates.description:
Concrete Crushing: slabs, beams or joints. Spalling of beam, column or joint cover concrete exposes longitudinal reinforcement or strength loss initiates in laboratory testing.
Exhibits concrete spalling that exposes longitudinal steel or crushing of core concrete.

damageStates.repairAction: Remove furnishings, ceilings and mechanical, electrical and plumbing systems (as necessary) 15 feet either side of damaged component. Place concrete forms. Place concrete. Remove forms. Remove shores after one week. Replace and repair finishes. Exhibits concrete spalling that exposes longitudinal steel or crushing of core concrete.
damageStates.name: DS2
damageStates.repairAction: Remove furnishings, ceilings and mechanical, electrical and plumbing systems (as necessary) 15 feet either side of damaged component.  Shore damaged member(s) a minimum of one level below (more levels may be required).  Remove damaged component.  Place and splice (as necessary) new reinforcing steel to existing, undamaged reinforcing.  Place concrete forms.  Place concrete.  Remove forms.  Remove shores after one week.  Replace and repair finishes.  Replace furnishings, ceilings and mechanical, electrical and plumbing systems (as necessary).

fragilities.comments:
Non-Conforming MF, column flexure, flexure-shear, or shear failure, column flexural response.  Meets the following requirements:  (1) Column Pu > 0.6f'cAg, (2) Column Vn < Veq  Costing is on a per joint basis.
Author: Laura Lowes
fragilities.description: Non-conforming MF, weak columns and strong joints, Conc Col & Bm = 24" x 36", Beam one side

damageStates.description: Concrete Cracking: beams, joints or possibly. Residual concrete crack widths exceed 0.06in. (1.5 mm).  Column exhibits residual crack widths that require epoxy injection.
damageStates.name: DS1
damageStates.repairAction: Remove furnishings, ceilings and mechanical, electrical and plumbing systems (as necessary) 8 feet either side of damaged area.  Clean area adjacent to the damaged concrete.  Prepare spalled concrete and adjacent cracks, as necessary, to be patched and to receive the epoxy injection. Patch concrete with grout.  Replace and repair finishes. Replace furnishings, ceilings and mechanical, electrical and plumbing systems as necessary.

damageStates.description:

fragilities.comments:
Non-Conforming MF, non-ductile failure, non-ductile response.  May exhibit the following:  (1) Splice detailing or length inadequate per ASCE 41-06 Table 6-7iii, (2) Beam or column reinforcing spliced at the face of joint, (3) Beam longitudinal steel discontinuous through joint per ASCE41-06 Table 6-7iii.  Costing is on a per joint basis.
Author: Laura Lowes
fragilities.description: Non-conforming MF with inadequate development of reinforcing, Conc Col & Bm = 24" x 24", Beam one side

damageStates.description: Damage is concentrated in beams, columns or joints depending on location of non-compliant detail.  Beams, columns or joints exhibit residual crack widths > 0.06 in.  No significant spalling.  No fracture or buckling of reinforcing.
damageStates.name: DS1
damageStates.repairAction: Remove furnishings, ceilings and mechanical, electrical and plumbing systems (as necessary) 8 feet either side of damaged area.  Clean area adjacent to the damaged concrete.  Prepare spalled concrete and adjacent cracks, as necessary, to be patched and to receive the epoxy injection. Patch concrete with grout.  Replace and repair finishes. Replace furnishings, ceilings and mechanical, electrical and plumbing systems as necessary.

damageStates.description: Damage is concentrated in beams, columns or joints depending on location of non-compliant detail.  Beams, columns or joints exhibit residual crack widths > 0.06 in.  Spalling of column cover concrete exposes a significant length of column longitudinal reinforcement.  Crushing of column core concrete may occur.  Fracture or buckling of reinf. requiring replacement may occur.

damageStates.repairAction: Remove furnishings, ceilings and mechanical, electrical and plumbing systems (as necessary) 15 feet either side of damaged component. fragilities.comments:
None
Author: John Wallace
fragilities.description: Concrete link beam, diagonally reinforced, aspect ratio between 1.0 and 2.0, beam < 16" wide and depth < 30"

damageStates.description: Residual cracks no greater than 1/16 inch.  Cracks are mainly at the beam to wall interface, some limited flexural cracking.
damageStates.name: DS1
damageStates.repairAction: Epoxy inject cracks (200 to 240 inches in length).

damageStates.description: Residual cracks greater than 1/8 inch and minor spalling of concrete.
damageStates.name: DS2
damageStates.repairAction: Epoxy inject cracks (600 to 720 inches) and slab (300 inches), replace spalled concrete.

damageStates.description: Significant strength degradation (<0.8Vn), buckling or fracture of diagonal reinforcing, crushing of concrete.
damageStates.name: DS3
damageStates.repairAction: Chip away damaged concrete, attached mechanical couplers to the diagonal bars still embedded in the wall, replace damaged or fractured reinforcing.  Replace damaged concrete.

fragilities.comments:
None

damageStates.repairAction: Epoxy inject cracks (600 to 720 inches) and slab (300 inches), replace spalled concrete.

damageStates.description: Significant strength degradation (<0.8Vn), buckling or fracture of diagonal reinforcing, crushing of concrete.
damageStates.name: DS3
damageStates.repairAction: Chip away damaged concrete, attached mechanical couplers to the diagonal bars still embedded in the wall, replace damaged or fractured reinforcing.  Replace damaged concrete.

fragilities.comments:
None
Author: John Wallace
fragilities.description: Concrete link beam, conventionally reinforced, aspect ratio between 2.0 and 4.0, beam > 24" wide and depth < 30"

damageStates.description: Residual cracks no greater than 1/16 inch.  Cracks are mainly at the beam to wall interface, some limited flexural cracking.
damageStates.name: DS1
damageStates.repairAction: Epoxy inject cracks (200 to 240 inches in length).

damageStates.description: Residual cracks greater than 1/8 inch and minor spalling of concrete.
damageStates.name: DS2
damageStates.repairAction: Epoxy inject cracks (600 to 720 inches) and slab (300 inches), replace spalled concrete.

fragilities.comments:
Costing for each 144 ft^2 Wall Panel, Orthogonal web reinforcement, f'c > 2500 psi, P/(A*f'c) <= 0.2
Notes: Full repair description does not fully fit on sheet - consider shortening.  Description will fit in PACT.
Author: Andrew Whittaker
fragilities.description: Rectangular low aspect ratio concrete walls 8" or less thick single curtain up to 15' high

damageStates.description: Cracks with maximum widths greater than 0.04 in but less than 0.12 in.
damageStates.name: DS1
damageStates.repairAction: Remove furnishings, ceilings and mechanical, electrical and plumping systems (as necessary) 5 feet either side of damaged area.  Replace and repair finishes.  Replace furnishings, ceilings and mechanical, electrical and plumping systems (as necessary).

damageStates.description: Crushed core concrete; localized concrete cracking with widths greater than 0.12 in; buckling of vertical rebar.
damageStates.name: DS2
damageStates.repairAction: (1) Relocate office eqpt & furniture within 6 ft. of wall, both sides. Install protective covers on floor finishes & adjacent curtain wall system.  (2) Remove arch. finishes on wall, both sides.  (3) Relocate MEP systems within 6 ft. of wall.  (4) Prepare & inject grout 330 ft. of crack per 100 ft2 of wall.  (5) Remove 15 ft2 per 100 ft2 of wall & 10 1-ft. long sections of #8 buckled vert. rebar.  (6) Replace buckled rebar with new rebar, attach to exposed ends of (E) rebar with mech splices; provide 8 #4 seismic ties at 4 in. oc, ea end of wall; re-bend 16 horiz. rebar in wall around new rebar.  (7) Install formwork & cast 5ksi concrete into pockets cut in step 5.  (8) Strip forms, clean-up, reinstall/return office eqpt., finishes, furniture & MEP.

damageStates.description: Sliding of the wall resulting in large residual displacement; distributed concrete cracking with widths greater than 0.12 in; fracture of rebar.
damageStates.name: DS3
damageStates.repairAction: (1) Relocate eqpt.& furniture within 10 ft. of wall, both sides. Install protection on floor & adjacent walls.  (2) Remove wall finishes, both sides.  (3) Relocate MEP within 10 ft. of wall.  (4) Remove damaged wall in 5-ft.lengths.  (5) Install bars: a. 12#9 A706 bars in bz ea. end; mech splices to (E) ; b. #4 A706 dbl sets of seismic ties at 4 in. oc ea bz; c. #4 A706 bar at 6 in. oc, ewef; lap new vert. bars to (E) at top of wall; drill & epoxy bars into wall/fdn at 6 in. oc to match new rebar above.  Anchor horiz.  Bars in bz with seismic hks or lap 24 in. with (E) horiz. bars.  (6) Form wall.  Cast 5ksi concrete in 3-ft. lifts; with 1-in. top gap for grout day after casting.  (7) Remove forms, clean-up & reinstall/return eqpt, finishes, furniture & MEP.

(7) Remove forms, clean-up & reinstall/return eqpt, finishes, furniture & MEP.

Costing for each 400 ft^2 Wall Panel, Orthogonal web reinforcement, f'c > 2500 psi, P/(A*f'c) <= 0.2

Author: Andrew Whittaker
fragilities.description: Low rise reinforced concrete walls with boundary columns, 17"-24" thick, height between 16'-24'

damageStates.description: Crushed core concrete; localized concrete cracking with widths greater than 0.12 in; buckling of vertical rebar.
damageStates.name: DS1
damageStates.repairAction: Remove furnishings, ceilings and mechanical, electrical and plumping systems (as necessary) 5 feet either side of damaged area.  Replace and repair finishes.  Replace furnishings, ceilings and mechanical, electrical and plumping systems (as necessary).

damageStates.description: Sliding of the wall resulting in large residual displacement; distributed concrete cracking with widths greater than 0.12 in; fracture of rebar.
damageStates.name: DS2
damageStates.repairAction: (1) Relocate eqpt.& furniture within 10 ft. of wall, both sides.  Install protection on floor & adjacent walls.  (2) Remove wall finishes, both sides.  (3) Relocate MEP within 10 ft. of wall.  (4) Remove damaged wall in 5-ft.lengths.  (5) Install bars: a. 12#9 A706 bars in bz ea. end; mech splices to (E) ; b. #4 A706 dbl sets of seismic ties at 4 in. oc ea bz; c. #4 A706 bar at 6 in. oc, ewef; lap new vert. bars to (E) at top of wall; drill & epoxy bars into wall/fdn at 6 in. oc to match new rebar above.  Anchor horiz.  Bars in bz with seismic hks or lap 24 in. with (E) horiz. bars.  (6) Form wall.  Cast 5ksi concrete in 3-ft. lifts; with 1-in. top gap for grout day after casting.  (7) Remove forms, clean-up & reinstall/return eqpt, finishes, furniture & MEP.

fragilities.comments: Slender concrete shear wall with aspect ratio greater than or equal to 2.0.  Costing assumes a 144 ft^2 wall panel.

damageStates.description: Spalling of cover, vertical cracks greater than 1/16 inch.
damageStates.name: DS1
damageStates.repairAction: Epoxy inject cracks and patch spalled concrete.

damageStates.description: Exposed longitudinal reinforcing.
damageStates.name: DS2

damageStates.description: Core concrete damage, buckled reinforcing, fractured reinforcing, shear failure, web failure, bond slip
damageStates.name: DS3
damageStates.repairAction: Replace wall or reinforce with R/C jacket if possible.  Shore floor and wall, remove damaged concrete and steel within one development length of damaged region, replace removed concrete and steel.

fragilities.comments:
Costing per joint, minimum of 6" thick slab, maximum of 12" thick slab.
Author: John Wallace
fragilities.description: Reinforced concrete flat slabs- columns without shear reinforcing  0<Vg/Vo<.2, no continuity reinf

damageStates.description: Yield strain of the slab flexural reinforcement has been exceeded, spalling of concrete may/may not occur, slab exhibits large enough crack widths to allow epoxy injection.
damageStates.name: DS1
damageStates.repairAction: Remove furnishings, ceilings and mechanical, electrical and plumping systems (as necessary) 5 feet either side of damaged area.  Replace and repair finishes.  Replace furnishings, ceilings and mechanical, electrical and plumping systems (as necessary).

damageStates.description: Punching occurs, causing significant spalling of concrete. Epoxy injection is no longer expected to be sufficient to restore the required strength and stiffness to the slab and the slab-column connection.
damageStates.name: DS2
damageStates.repairAction: Shore damaged area in the two stories below. Remove 100 square feet of concrete slab per column, preserving the slab reinforcement; lap splice 30 new 10 foot long rebar with existing rebar; place formwork; recast concrete slab; remove forms, replace and repair finishes; replace furnishings, ceilings, mechanical, electrical, and plumbing systems.  Cracks wide enough to be grouted are included in the portion of slab to be demolished and recast.

fragilities.comments:

fragilities.description: Reinforced concrete flat slabs- columns without shear reinforcing  0<Vg/Vo<.2, with continuity reinf

damageStates.description: Yield strain of the slab flexural reinforcement has been exceeded, spalling of concrete may/may not occur, slab exhibits large enough crack widths to allow epoxy injection.

damageStates.name: DS1
damageStates.repairAction: Remove furnishings, ceilings and mechanical, electrical and plumping systems (as necessary) 5 feet either side of damaged area.  Replace and repair finishes.  Replace furnishings, ceilings and mechanical, electrical and plumping systems (as necessary).

damageStates.description: Punching occurs causing significant spalling of concrete.
damageStates.name: DS2
damageStates.repairAction: Shore damaged area in the two stories below. Remove 100 square feet of concrete slab per column, preserving the slab reinforcement; lap splice 30 new 10 foot long rebar with existing rebar; place formwork; recast concrete slab; remove forms, replace and repair finishes; replace furnishings, ceilings, mechanical, electrical, and plumbing systems. Cracks wide enough to be grouted are included in the portion of slab to be demolished and recast.

fragilities.comments:
Costing is on a per joint basis.
Notes: Fragilities were based on judgment due to lack of test data.  The only available data were from a specimen that was constructed using ACI 318-89
Author: John Wallace
fragilities.description: Reinforced concrete flat slabs drop panel or drop capital- columns without shear reinforcing  0<Vg/Vo<0.4, with continuity reinf

damageStates.description: Yield strain of the slab flexural reinforcement has been exceeded.  Spalling of concrete may or may not occur.  Slab exhibits large enough crack widths to allow epoxy injection.
damageStates.name: DS1
damageStates.repairAction: Remove furnishings, ceilings and mechanical, electrical and plumping systems (as necessary) 5 feet either side of damaged area.  Replace and repair finishes.  Replace furnishings, ceilings and mechanical, electrical and plumping systems (as necessary).

damageStates.description: Punching occurs causing significant spalling of concrete.
damageStates.name: DS2
damageStates.repairAction: Prepare work area for epoxy injection, inject epoxy into 40 feet of crack (30 feet top, 10 feet bottom of slab) per 100 square feet of floor panel.  Fabricate new structural steel shear head (column capital) that attaches to the column beneath the slab.

fragilities.comments:
Costing for each 100 ft^2 Wall Panel
Author: Benson Shing
fragilities.description: Ordinary reinforced masonry walls with partially grouted cells, shear dominated, 4" to 6"' thick, up to 12 foot tall

damageStates.description: First occurrence of major diagonal cracks.  Cracks remain closed with hardly noticeable residual crack widths after load removal.
damageStates.name: DS1
damageStates.repairAction: Grout wall.  Epoxy injection.  Paint each side.

damageStates.description: Wide diagonal cracks with typically one or more cracks in each direction.  Crushing or spalling at wall toes.
damageStates.name: DS2
damageStates.repairAction: Shore.  Demolish existing wall.  Construct new wall.

fragilities.comments:
Costing for each 225 ft^2 Wall Panel
Author: Benson Shing
fragilities.description: Ordinary reinforced masonry walls with partially grouted cells, shear dominated, 4" to 6"' thick, greater than 12 foot tall

damageStates.name: DS1

fragilities.comments:
Costing for each 100 ft^2 Wall Panel
Author: Benson Shing
fragilities.description: Ordinary reinforced masonry walls with partially grouted cells, 4" to 6" thick, flexure dominated up to 12' tall

damageStates.description: A few flexural and shear cracks with hardly noticeable residual crack widths.  Slight yielding of extreme vertical reinforcement.  No spalling.  No fracture or buckling of vertical reinforcement.  No structurally significant damage.
damageStates.name: DS1
damageStates.repairAction: Cosmetic repair.  Patch cracks and paint each side.

damageStates.description: Numerous flexural and diagonal cracks with residual crack widths less than 1/64 in.  Mild toe crushing with vertical cracks or light spalling at wall toes.  No fracture or buckling of reinforcement.  Small residual deformation.
damageStates.name: DS2
damageStates.repairAction: Remove loose masonry.  Patch spalls with non-shrink grout.  Grout wall.  Epoxy injection.  Paint each side.

damageStates.description: Severe flexural cracks with residual crack widths greater than 1/32 in.  Severe toe crushing and spalling.  Fracture or buckling of vertical reinforcement.  Significant residual deformation.
damageStates.name: DS3
damageStates.repairAction: Shore. - Demolish existing wall. - Construct new wall.

fragilities.comments:
Costing for each 100 ft^2 Wall Panel.   Assumed framing:  38 mil cold formed steel framing with 7/16 OSB and 3/8 plywood panel sheathing with overturning restraint at each end of the wall per AISI design standard.  No. 8 screws 2" to 6" OC at perimeter and 12" OC EW in field.  
Construction Quality: High quality
Seismic Installation Conditions: Overturning restraint at each end of wall.
fragilities.description: Cold formed steel walls with wood structural panel sheathing, interior - gypsum board

damageStates.description: Sheathing faster pull through or tear out.  (20% of fasteners.)
damageStates.name: DS1
damageStates.repairAction: Remove damaged wall, ceilings, mechanical, electrical, and office furniture / equipment.  Temporarily protect floor and provide dust curtains.  Modify mechanical and electrical as required for repair work.  Replace 20% of fasteners, replace gypsum wall board, tape and sand, repaint.

damageStates.description: Failure of structural panels.
damageStates.name: DS2
damageStates.repairAction: Remove damaged wall, ceilings, mechanical, electrical, and office furniture / equipment.  Temporarily protect floor and provide dust curtains.  Modify mechanical and electrical as required for repair work.  Replace sheathing, replace gypsum wall board, tape and sand, repaint.

damageStates.description: Failure of wall.
damageStates.name: DS3
damageStates.repairAction: Remove damaged wall, ceilings, mechanical, electrical, and office furniture / equipment.  Temporarily protect floor and provide dust curtains.  Provide shoring.  Modify mechanical and electrical as required for repair work.  Replace metal stud framing, boundary elements, sheathing, replace gypsum wall board, tape and sand, repaint.

fragilities.comments:
Costing for each 100 ft^2 Wall Panel.   Assumed framing:  33 mil cold formed steel framing with 4.5 inch x 33 mil flat strap X-bracing on one side.  Straps attached to gussets with No. 8 screws.
Construction Quality: High quality
Seismic Installation Conditions: Overturning restrains required and sheathing screws driven flush with the surface of the strapping.
fragilities.description: Cold formed steel walls with flat strap X-bracing, interior - gypsum board

damageStates.description: Local buckling of chord studs.
damageStates.name: DS1
damageStates.repairAction: Remove damaged wall, ceilings, X bracing as necessary, mechanical, electrical, and office furniture / equipment.  Temporarily protect floor and provide dust curtains.  Modify mechanical and electrical as required for repair work.  Replace gypsum wall board, metal stud framing as needed, reinstall X bracing as required, tape and sand, repaint.

damageStates.description: Failure of many framing members and collapse.
damageStates.name: DS2
damageStates.repairAction: Remove damaged wall, ceilings, X bracing as necessary, mechanical, electrical, and office furniture / equipment.  Temporarily protect floor and provide dust curtains.  Modify mechanical and electrical as required for repair work.  Replace gypsum wall board, boundary elements, metal stud framing, install X bracing, tape and sand, repaint.

damageStates.repairAction: Remove damaged wall, ceilings, wall finishes, mechanical, electrical, and office furniture / equipment.  Temporarily protect floor and provide dust curtains.  Modify mechanical and electrical as required for repair work.  Replace 20% of fasteners, replace gypsum wall board, tape, sand, paint.

damageStates.description: Buckling of steel sheathing.  Buckling of framing members.
damageStates.name: DS2
damageStates.repairAction: Remove damaged wall, ceilings, wall finishes, mechanical, electrical, and office furniture / equipment.  Temporarily protect floor and provide dust curtains.  Modify mechanical and electrical as required for repair work.  Install new sheathing, new metal stud framing as needed, replace gypsum wall board, tape, sand, paint.

fragilities.comments:
Costing for each 100 ft^2 Wall Panel.   Assumed framing:  33 mil cold formed steel framing with 22 or 31 mil steel sheathing attached with No. 8 screws spaced 2" or 6" OC at perimeter and 12" OC EW in the field.
Construction Quality: High quality
Seismic Installation Conditions: Overturning restrains required and sheathing screws driven flush with the surface of the strapping.

fragilities.comments:
Costing for each 100 ft^2 Wall Panel.   Assumed framing:  1 SIDE: 3/8" OSB or 15/32 ply with 8d box nails at 4 to 6 inches along panel edges and 12 inches field nailing. DF #2, 2x4@16 studs. 1 SIDE: 1/2 gypsum board. Panel 8 feet tall, 8 or 16 feet long with or without door and window openings, double top plate, single bottom plate, no hold-downs. 
Author: Andre Filiatrault

damageStates.name: DS1
damageStates.repairAction: Clean stucco cracks. Fill cracks with cement compound. Repaint wall to hide cracks.

damageStates.description: Spalling of stucco, separation of stucco and sheathing from studs.
damageStates.name: DS2
damageStates.repairAction: Remove loose stucco and patch spalled areas with stucco. Repaint to hide repairs.

damageStates.description: Fracture of studs, major sill plate cracking.
damageStates.name: DS3
damageStates.repairAction: Remove and replace studs, plates, sheathing, and stucco. Shore as required.

fragilities.description: Light framed wood walls with structural panel sheathing, stucco,  hold-downs

damageStates.description: Cracking of stucco.
damageStates.name: DS1
damageStates.repairAction: Clean stucco cracks. Fill cracks with cement compound. Repaint wall to hide cracks.

damageStates.description: Spalling of stucco, separation of stucco and sheathing from studs.
damageStates.name: DS2
damageStates.repairAction: Remove loose stucco and patch spalled areas with stucco. Repaint to hide repairs.

damageStates.description: Fracture of studs, major sill plate cracking.
damageStates.name: DS3
damageStates.repairAction: Remove and replace studs, plates, sheathing, and stucco. Shore as required.

fragilities.comments:
Costing for each 100 ft^2 Wall Panel.   Assumed framing:  Stud wall framing consists of 2 x 4’s at 16 inches on center with double top plates and single sill plate. Diagonal bracing includes 2 forms. Block-bracing consists of diagonal blocking between studs that extends from the top of one edge of the panel to the bottom of the opposite edge. Diagonal bracing may also consist of let-in bracing for which a 1x or 2x brace (with same inclination as described for block-bracing) is recessed into studs. Walls may be sheathed with horizontal or vertical lumber siding.
Author: Andre Filiatrault
fragilities.description: Wood walls with diagonal let-in bracing

damageStates.description: Failure of diagonal bracing.
damageStates.name: DS1
damageStates.repairAction: Remove and replace sheathing studs, plates and bracing and replace with new stud wall construction of plywood, hold-downs, etc. Provide shoring as required.

fragilities.comments:
Costing based upon 13'x100' Panels
Construction Quality: Normal
Notes: Copy of C1011.011a for use as an exterior wall.
fragilities.description: Exterior Wall - Type: Gypsum with wood studs, Full Height, Fixed Below, Fixed Above

damageStates.description: Screws pop-out, minor cracking of wall board, warping or cracking of tape.
damageStates.name: DS1
damageStates.repairAction: Retape joints, paste and repaint both sides of  full 100 foot length of wall board.

damageStates.description: Moderate cracking or crushing of gypsum wall boards (typically in corners and in corners of openings).
damageStates.name: DS2
damageStates.repairAction: Remove full 100 foot length of wall board (both sides), install new wall board (both sides), tape, paste and repaint.

damageStates.description: Significant cracking and/or crushing of gypsum wall boards- buckling of studs and tearing of tracks.
damageStates.name: DS3
damageStates.repairAction: Remove and replace full 100 foot length of metal stud wall, both sides of the gypsum wall board and any embedded utilities, and tape, paste and repaint.

fragilities.comments:
Costing for each 100 ft^2 Wall Panel.   Assumed framing:  38 mil cold formed steel framing with 7/16 OSB and 3/8 plywood panel sheathing with overturning restraint at each end of the wall per AISI design standard.  No. 8 screws 2" to 6" OC at perimeter and 12" OC EW in field.  
Construction Quality: High quality
Seismic Installation Conditions: Overturning restraint at each end of wall.
Notes: Copy of B1061.001a for use as an exterior wall.
fragilities.description: Exterior Wall - Cold formed steel walls with wood structural panel sheathing, interior - gypsum board

fragilities.comments:
Demand parameter shall be defined as the first floor peak floor acceleration.  Unreinforced masonry chimney as a component of wood frame buildings.  Includes firebox and chimney, excludes exterior veneer or ornamentation.  May include chimneys where the quality of reinforcing is unknown.  For multiple story buildings enter the chimney fragility once at the first floor, do not specify this fragility at subsequent elevated floors.
Construction Quality: Normal
Seismic Installation Conditions: All
Notes: Rebuilding with masonry will restore the chimney to its pre-earthquake condition.  Some jurisdictions prohibit unreinforced reconstruction and require either replacement of the damaged portion of the chimney with a metal flue within wood frame chase or a complete removal of the existing fireplace and chimney with replacement with a code compliant reinforced masonry design.  
Toppled chimney may cause damage to adjacent structure.
fragilities.description: Masonry Chimney - unreinforced, non industrial, above roof 5 ft, replace with masonry

damageStates.description: Cracking with offset > 1/16"
damageStates.name: DS1
damageStates.repairAction:
Rebuild above break or replace entire chimney.
Addl comments (edit or delete as necessary):  Rebuilding with masonry will restore the chimney to its pre-earthquake condition.  Some jurisdictions prohibit unreinforced reconstruction and require either replacement of the damaged portion of the chimney with a metal flue within wood frame chase or a complete removal of the existing fireplace and chimney with replacement with a code compliant reinforced masonry design.  
Toppled chimney may cause damage to adjacent structure.

damageStates.description: Toppling of all or a portion of the chimney.
damageStates.name: DS2
damageStates.repairAction: Rebuild above break or replace entire chimney.

fragilities.comments:
Quantity is based upon 13'x100' Panels.  Quantity of wall damaged varies by damage state.
Construction Quality: Normal
fragilities.description: Wall Partition, Type: Gypsum with metal studs, Full Height, Fixed Below, Fixed Above

damageStates.description: Screw pop-out, cracking of wall board, warping or cracking of tape, slight crushing of wall panel at corners.
damageStates.name: DS1
damageStates.repairAction: Retape joints, paste and repaint.  May require cutting and replacing corner sections of board.  Repair 5% wallboard, 10% retape, 25% repaint.

damageStates.description: Moderate cracking or crushing of gypsum wall boards (typically in corners).  Moderate corner gap openings, bending of boundary studs.
damageStates.name: DS2
damageStates.repairAction: Remove and replace 10% of wall board (both sides), retape and paste 25% of wall, paint 50% of wall.  Replace boundary studs of approximately 5 intersections per 100 ft of wall length.

damageStates.description: Buckling of studs and tearing of tracks.  Tearing or bending of top track, tearing at corners with transverse walls, large gap openings, walls displaced.
damageStates.name: DS3
damageStates.repairAction: Remove and replace 50% of length of metal stud wall, 50% of both sides of the gypsum, and any embedded utilities.  Retape and paste as required.  Repaint 100%.

damageStates.description: Cracking of paint over fasteners or joints.
damageStates.name: DS1
damageStates.repairAction: Gypsum wallboard repaired by replacing the tape along the seam of two adjacent panels, applying new joint compound, sanding, and repainting.

damageStates.description: Local and global buckling out-of-plane and crushing of gypsum wallboards.  Studs are typically not damaged by failure of the gypsum wallboard.
damageStates.name: DS2
damageStates.repairAction: Replace 25 feet of the affected panel along with the application of new tape, joint compound, followed by sanding and repainting.  Studs are not damaged.

damageStates.description: Local and global buckling out-of-plane and crushing of gypsum wallboards.  Studs are typically not damaged by failure of the gypsum wallboard.
damageStates.name: DS3
damageStates.repairAction: Replace 100 feet of the affected panel along with the application of new tape, joint compound, followed by sanding and repainting.  Studs are not damaged.

fragilities.comments:
The user needs to review the fragilities of all piping modeled in the ceiling of the floor and input the peak floor acceleration value for the pipe with the lowest median peak floor acceleration value, along with the associated total dispersion (beta).  Flooring type assumed to be carpet or vinyl. Available costs are per one square foot of floor area.  
Construction Quality: Normal
fragilities.description: Generic Floor Covering - Flooding of floor caused by failure of pipe - Office - Dry

damageStates.description: Flooding of all or a portion of the total floor associated with a major leakage of a pipe.
damageStates.name: DS1
damageStates.repairAction: Replace or dry out of the affected flooring materials, equipment and contents.  Remove areas that could be affected by mold.  Potentially considerable downtime.  Cleanup and replacement of all water damaged items on floor.  User must establish area of floor with flooding.  Default recommendation is flooding of total floor area.  Damage to unit floor area shall be entered to consequence which is multiplied by PACT "Fragility Unit of Measure".

fragilities.comments:
Horizontal light fixtures 4 to 16 ft long suspended 12 to 24 inches from ceiling.  No seismic design or bracing.  Hung from ceiling above by two or more rods or cables.

fragilities.comments:

fragilities.comments:
Unanchored and installed per manufacturer's recommendations on a carpeted floor.
Construction Quality: Any
Seismic Installation Conditions: Unsecured
Notes: This component requires user specified cost and time consequence data.  Values within PACT are defaults (equal to zero) and do not represent actual consequence.
fragilities.description: Modular office work stations.

damageStates.description: Wall units need to be adjusted and straightened.  Some elements are bent / damaged and need to be replaced.
damageStates.name: DS1
damageStates.repairAction: Adjust and or straightened wall units.  Replace damaged units.  Assume a repair cost of 5% of the replacement value.

fragilities.comments:
Costing to be furnished by user.  Consequence data assumes 16 SF of damage area.

Seismic Installation Conditions: Unknown conditions: some objects may have museum putty. Some cabinets may have latches. Some cabinets may be secured to the wall.

fragilities.comments:
Standard bookcase, unanchored laterally.  Bookcase is 12-5/8" deep x 29" tall
Construction Quality: Normal
Seismic Installation Conditions: Unsecured
Notes: Peak floor velocity limit is calculated as a function of the aspect ratio of the filing cabinet and the building period, T.  At the ground floor the fragility will be based upon the ground motion only.  This component requires user specified cost and time consequence data.  Values within PACT are defaults (equal to zero) and do not represent actual consequence.
fragilities.description: Bookcase, 2 shelves, unanchored laterally

damageStates.description: Book case falls over and contents are scattered.  Likely damage to bookcase.
damageStates.name: DS1
damageStates.repairAction: Replace bookcase and restack / replace contents.

Seismic Installation Conditions: Varies
fragilities.description: Storage racks designed and installed before 2007, big box retail (12' to 15' tall)

damageStates.description: Significant merchandise shedding from rack shelves.
damageStates.name: DS1
damageStates.repairAction: Minor repair to storage rack.  Resort and restock shelves.  Clean up debris.

damageStates.description: Significant structural damage to rack structure.
damageStates.name: DS2
